name: November 2nd
description:
Émile-Antoine Bayard was a French illustrator born in La Ferté-sous-Jouarre, Seine-et-Marne on 2 November 1837. He is best known by many for his illustration of Cosette from Les Misérables by Victor Hugo.

While there had been art depicting spaceflight and alien worlds prior to 1865, they were based heavily on mysticism as opposed to science. Bayard's artwork accompanying From the Earth to the Moon by Jules Verne is considered among the first Space art of a scientific nature. via Wikipedia

The drawings of "From the Earth to the Moon" impressed me so I made a collage of his. Maybe his drawings also took us to the moon.
